metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19319 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.2, a setxattr operation, after a mount of acrafted ext4 image, can cause a slab-out-of-bounds write access because ofan ext4_xattr_set_entry use-after-free in fs/ext4/xattr.c when a largeold_size value is used in a memset call, aka CID-345c0dbf3a30.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19319` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-184.214
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-66.75~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-66.75~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-66.75~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1075.82
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1109.120
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1052.54~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1061.66
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1047.50
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1027.30~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1134-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1134.143
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1138-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1138.146
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-184.214').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-66.75~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1075.82').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1109.120').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1052.54~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1061.66').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.50').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1027.30~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1134.143').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1138.146').
